newsitem.title: UK: Queensland 1996 cane area set to rise 5.7 pct.
newsitem.headline: Queensland 1996 cane area set to rise 5.7 pct.

text.p: The area assigned to sugarcane in Queensland should rise by 5.7 percent in 1996 over the total national area of 525,000 hectares in 1995, the general manager of the Australian Sugar Milling Council said on Wednesday.

Queensland produces some 95 percent of Australia's sugar. "There has been strong support for expansion from existing and new growers, reflecting the pent-up demand from the 1980s as well as market opportunities for Australian raws," said John Desmarchelier.

Speaking at a two-day seminar hosted by the International Sugar Organization (ISO), Desmarchelier said there had been a planned expansion of Queensland's assigned area of around 44 percent since 1988.
He added that Australia's Sugar Industry Act had authorised the QSC to increase the assigned area to cane by a miminum of 2.5 percent in each year.
